title: From Waste to $5,000: Ocean Industries Go Circular
content:
ğŸŒŠ Session 2 Highlights from Nordic Circular Summit in Nuuk

23 million metric tons of edible seafood wasted annually. But Iceland, Greenland, Finland, Denmark, and Norway are changing that.

Key Takeaways:

Atlantic cod: $12 â†’ $5,000 potential value per fish

The lesson: Solutions lie between sectors, not within them.

#CircularEconomy #OceanIndustries #Seafood #NordicCircularSummit #RoyalGreenland #IcelandOceanCluster #Sustainability

title: 23 Million Metric Tons
content:
ğŸ’” "We lose and waste more than 23 million metric tons of edible quality aquatic food.

This is not only environmentally impactful, but economically wasteful."

â€” Alexandra Leeper, CEO of Iceland Ocean Cluster at #NordicCircularSummit

The good news? Iceland went from using 45% of each fish to over 90%.

The methodology is transferable:
âœ… Know your species and volumes
âœ… Understand current processing
âœ… Identify properties of side streams
âœ… Assess market opportunities
âœ… Build business cases

We don't need to reinvent the wheel. The 100% Fish philosophy worksâ€”and it scales.

Global seafood demand is predicted to nearly double by 2050. We already have the solution in what we currently waste.

#CircularEconomy #Seafood #OceanIndustries #100PercentFish #Sustainability #FoodWaste
speaker: Alexandra Leeper
media_suggestion: Quote card with Alexandra's photo and 23M tons statistic visualization

title: Cod Value Transformation
content:
ğŸŸ Atlantic cod value transformation:

âŒ Using just fillet: ~$12
âœ… Using 100% (heads, skin, bones, guts, blood): ~$5,000

That's a 41,567% increase.

Iceland did it. Now it's scaling across Nordics.

#CircularOcean #100PercentFish
speaker: Alexandra Leeper

title: Side Streams Are Superfood
content:
ğŸŸ SIDE STREAMS = SUPERFOOD ğŸ¥—

What the seafood industry calls "waste" is actually nutritionally SUPERIOR to fillets:

ğŸ“Š Compared to fillets, side streams have:
ğŸ”¹ 20x more CALCIUM
ğŸ”¹ 10x more ZINC
ğŸ”¹ 5x more COLLAGEN
ğŸ”¹ 2x more IRON

Imagine eating collagen in your food instead of buying expensive pills ğŸ’Š

This is what Michaela LindstrÃ¶m and Hylia Nordic (@hylianordic) are doing in Finlandâ€”transforming side streams into products that taste like familiar seafood.

8 products now in Finnish retail:
âœ… Chilled
âœ… Frozen
âœ… Ready meals
âœ… Canned goods

15% of global seafood is wasted at the processing stage. With demand doubling by 2050, we already have the solution in our hands.

We just need to utilize it smarter.

ğŸ† Awards:
â€¢ UN UNIDO Global Call
â€¢ Best Business Food Tech Award

Learn more at Nordic Circular Summit 2025 in Nuuk, Greenland.

#Seafood #Superfood #SideStreams #CircularEconomy #FoodInnovation #HyliaNordic #NordicCircularSummit #Nuuk #Greenland #ZeroWaste #Sustainability #HealthyEating

title: Circular Ocean Industries Session Recap
content:
ğŸŒŠ CIRCULAR OCEAN INDUSTRIES - Session 2 Recap from Nuuk!

What happens when ocean industry leaders from Iceland, Greenland, Finland, Denmark, and Norway gather to share circular economy breakthroughs?

Magic. ğŸª„

TOP MOMENTS:

ğŸ‡®ğŸ‡¸ ICELAND: Alexandra Leeper (Iceland Ocean Cluster) shared how Iceland went from wasting 55% of each fish to utilizing 90%+. Value per cod: $12 â†’ $5,000.

ğŸ‡¬ğŸ‡± GREENLAND: Kristian Ottesen (Royal Greenland) revealed how they transformed a shrimp meal factory from losing 800K DKK/year to profitable. Their secret? Cultural buy-in + Nordic partnerships.

ğŸ‡«ğŸ‡® FINLAND: Michaela LindstrÃ¶m (Hylia Nordic) proved side streams are superfoodâ€”20x more calcium, 10x more zinc than fillets. 8 products now in retail!

ğŸ‡©ğŸ‡° DENMARK: Linn Indrestrand (Danish Ocean Cluster) explained how logistics determines everything. Quality degrades with each move = price degrades.

ğŸ‡³ğŸ‡´ NORWAY: Monika Poulsen (ACT Cluster) with 119 partners showed that solutions lie BETWEEN sectors, not within them.

THE BIG PICTURE:
23 million metric tons of edible seafood wasted annually. Global demand doubling by 2050. The solution already exists in what we currently waste.

We just need to utilize it smarter.

KEY LESSONS:
âœ… 100% Fish methodology is transferable
âœ… Corporate transformation requires culture change
âœ… Side streams have superior nutrition
âœ… Clusters enable at scale
âœ… Cross-sectoral beats single-sector thinking
âœ… Trust infrastructure matters most

Thank you to everyone who joined us in Nuuk and online! ğŸ™

Full transcript and article available at nordiccircularsummit.com/transcripts

#CircularOcean #CircularEconomy #Seafood #NordicCircularSummit #Nuuk #Greenland #Sustainability #OceanIndustries #100PercentFish #RoyalGreenland #IcelandOceanCluster
